page.title: 20ATTITUDES-EXTRACTS,NEWCASTLE
page.content: I am lucky because my parents can afford a house,but some people...have to live in the tall storey flats. (Girl, 11yrs,Walkergate). I don't think people believe in the Church as they used to, because hardly any go. (Vicar,Hebburn). From almost all interviewees came satisfaction with living in 1985 in the area because of the friendliness of neighbours and a feeling of community spirit.Dissatisfaction was occasioned by graffiti,vandalism,the crime-rate in general (particularly violence), children's swearing in the street,limited employment prospects, poor working conditions and the high cost of living.Improvements suggested were a more convenient supermarket in the housing estates,a disco,an ice rink and a change of Government.
